title: Kash Patel - FBI Director with '60 Enemies' List
summary: Trump appointed Kash Patel as FBI Director despite Bill Barr saying 'Over my dead body.' Published book with appendix listing 60 'enemies' to target. Promoted QAnon, helped J6 defendants, vowed to 'shut down FBI headquarters' and reopen as 'museum of the deep state.'
keyFacts: Attorney General Bill Barr blocked him from FBI in first term: 'Over my dead body' - said Patel 'had virtually no experience'
Published book 'Government Gangsters' with appendix listing 60 'enemies' - public servants to target
Enemies list includes: Bill Barr, Merrick Garland, Bob Mueller, Chris Wray, Lloyd Austin, Joe Biden
Vowed to 'shut down FBI headquarters on Day 1' and reopen as 'museum of the deep state'
Founded charity to help January 6 defendants pay legal costs
Helped produce 'J6 Prison Choir' recording played at Trump rallies
Promoted QAnon conspiracy theories; signed books with '#WWG1WGA' (QAnon slogan)
Falsely claimed 'FBI was planning January 6 for a year beforehand'
People on his 'enemies list' reported relocating families, taking security precautions
Intensified use of polygraph tests asking FBI employees if they had criticized him

sources.text: CNN: Who is Kash Patel, Trump's pick for FBI director?
CNN: People on Kash Patel's so-called 'enemies list' taking precautions
Newsweek: Kash Patel's 'government gangsters' who could be targeted
